intro: Linosyris ceruminosa, commonly known as the earwax plant, is a flowering plant species native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in dry, rocky soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its scientific name refers to the waxy, sticky substance that covers its leaves and stems. Linosyris ceruminosa is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
